techniques.name: DNS Timing Covert Channel
techniques.description: Measure DNS query response times for forbidden vs allowed domains
techniques.details: DNS works for both, timing differences exist but no HTTP escape

techniques.name: TCP SYN Timing Analysis
techniques.description: Use connection timing to discover open/filtered ports
techniques.details: iptables NAT redirects all traffic to Squid before timing analysis

techniques.name: Squid Cache Poisoning Race
techniques.description: Send 10 concurrent requests to poison Squid's cache
techniques.details: All concurrent requests blocked with 403 Forbidden

techniques.name: HTTP/1.1 Keep-Alive Hijacking
techniques.description: Use persistent connection to switch from allowed to forbidden domain
techniques.details: Each request validated individually by Squid

techniques.name: Squid Error Page Exploitation
techniques.description: Inject malformed requests with special characters
techniques.details: Squid validates and rejects malformed requests

techniques.name: /proc/self/exe Overwrite
techniques.description: Attempt to overwrite running binary via procfs
techniques.details: /proc/self/exe is read-only, write denied

techniques.name: CGroup Memory OOM Attack
techniques.description: Write to cgroup settings to trigger OOM and crash Squid
techniques.details: No write access to cgroup settings

techniques.name: Namespace Manipulation via /proc/$$/ns
techniques.description: Use nsenter/unshare to enter different namespace
techniques.details: CAP_SYS_ADMIN not available, nsenter/unshare blocked

techniques.name: Shared /tmp Exploitation
techniques.description: Write data to /tmp visible to host or other containers
techniques.details: /tmp is container-local, not shared

techniques.name: Mount Namespace Host Escape
techniques.description: Check for accessible host filesystem mounts
techniques.details: No host mounts found, /host not accessible, Docker socket not mounted

techniques.name: HTTP TRACE Method Reflection
techniques.description: Use TRACE method for information leakage
techniques.details: TRACE method blocked by Squid with 403 Forbidden

techniques.name: Squid ICP Protocol
techniques.description: Test Inter-Cache Protocol on UDP port 3130
techniques.details: UDP traffic blocked except DNS to trusted servers

techniques.name: SOCKS4a Protocol
techniques.description: Send SOCKS4a proxy protocol handshake
techniques.details: Squid expects HTTP protocol, not SOCKS

techniques.name: Squid Connection Exhaustion
techniques.description: Open 50 persistent connections to exhaust connection pool
techniques.details: Squid still accepts connections, no exhaustion achieved

techniques.name: DNS Query Flooding
techniques.description: Send 100 DNS queries rapidly to trigger failover
techniques.details: DNS flood doesn't affect HTTP filtering

techniques.name: Seccomp/BPF Bypass
techniques.description: Test BPF syscall availability to bypass seccomp
techniques.details: Seccomp enforced, BPF requires CAP_SYS_ADMIN/CAP_BPF

techniques.name: Kernel Module Exploitation
techniques.description: Attempt to load malicious kernel module
techniques.details: CAP_SYS_MODULE not available, insmod not found

techniques.name: Ptrace Injection
techniques.description: Attempt ptrace attach to other processes
techniques.details: CAP_SYS_PTRACE not available, strace not found

techniques.name: IP Protocol Number Bypass
techniques.description: Use non-TCP/UDP protocols like ICMP
techniques.details: CAP_NET_RAW not available, cannot create raw sockets

techniques.name: DNS EDNS0 Client Subnet
techniques.description: Use EDNS0 options to exfiltrate data via DNS
techniques.details: EDNS0 passes through but DNS-only, not HTTP
